title: Ticket #3943: comments in authorization policy create unexpected behavior
description:
The authorization policy 

    ALLOW_WRITE = host1 # host2

allows writes from both host1 and host2, because 

    $ condor_config_val ALLOW_WRITE
    host1 # host2

The same is true if the comment follows a line continuation as in 

    ALLOW_WRITE = \
       host1 \
    #  host2

If we can't make comments generally work the way they should in config files, then perhaps the authorization policy parser should EXCEPT when it finds a hash sign in its input, because this almost certainly indicates a mistaken understanding by the admin about how the hash sign is interpreted.

I've only verified this behavior in 8.0 and 8.1, but I'd guess this behavior goes back much further.
